topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.0 Alpha: Applying the Horizon Patch

body.p: This patch is intended to update the Horizon package for windriver/rebranding changes.

After HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade is fully deployed, and is up and running, follow these steps to update the new Horizon package on your cloud:
Login to your KVM Host as root:
Delete the existing horizon debian from the CG repo
rm -f /var/cache/hlm/repo/debian/hoscg-horizon-2015.1.2.481-1.deb
Copy the new Horizon debian you downloaded to /var/cache/hlm/repo/debian on KVM Host. You should have downloaded the hoscg-horizon-2015.1.2.487-1.deb file in the prerequisites.
cd /var/cache/hlm/repo/debian d. Execute the following to generate the package index. => /root/cg-hlm/dev-tools/dpkg-scanpackages --multiversion . /dev/null | gzip -9c > Packages.gz 2. Perform the following steps on all the controller nodes a. Purge/install Horizon package: => apt-get update; apt-get purge hoscg-horizon; apt-get install hoscg-horizon b. Execute these two commands on terminal: => DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=openstack_dashboard.settings /opt/stack/venvs/horizon/bin/django-admin collectstatic (Types 'yes' when prompted) => DJANGO_SETTINGS_MODULE=openstack_dashboard.settings /opt/stack/venvs/horizon/bin/django-admin compress c. Restart apache service: => service apache2 restart
Return to the KVM + ESX installation.
